intro: Bikkia guilloviana, commonly known as the Guilloviana bikkia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple and white. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cool, moist conditions. Bikkia guilloviana is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture.
